section.title: List of codes used for specific Extraoral Views
section.para: Codes for the drawings shown in Figure 3; the user can customize view sets by selecting the desired views and the applicable SNOMED CT codes.

td.para: Right Profile (subject is facing observer's right) – Lips Relaxed, Centric Occlusion
Right Profile (subject is facing observer's right) – Lips Relaxed, Centric Relation
Right Profile (subject is facing observer's right) – Lips Closed, Centric Occlusion
Right Profile (subject is facing observer's right) - Lips Closed, Centric Relation
Right profile (subject is facing observer's right) - Full Smile, Centric Occlusion
Right Profile (subject is facing observer's right) - Full Smile, Centric Relation
Right Profile (subject is facing observer's right) - Mandible Postured Forward
45° Right Profile (subject turns toward observer's right) – Lips Relaxed, Centric Occlusion
45° Right Profile (subject turns toward observer's right) – Lips Relaxed, Centric Relation
45° Right Profile (subject turns toward observer's right) – Lips Closed, Centric Occlusion
45° Right Profile (subject turns toward observer's right) – Lips Closed, Centric Relation
45° Right Profile (subject turns toward observer's right) – Full Smile, Centric Occlusion
45° Right Profile (subject turns toward observer's right – Full Smile, Centric Relation
45° Right Profile (subject turns toward observer's right – Mandible Postured Forward
Full Face – Lips Relaxed, Centric Occlusion
Full Face - Lips Relaxed, Centric Relation
Full Face – Lips Closed, Centric Occlusion
Full Face - Lips Closed, Centric Relation
Full Face – Full Smile, Centric Occlusion
Example: Patient in permanent dentition may show the following teeth in this view
Full Face - Full Smile, Centric Relation
Example: Patient in primary dentition may show the following teeth in this view
Left Profile (subject is facing observer's left) – Lips Relaxed, Centric Occlusion
Left Profile (subject is facing observer's left) – Lips Relaxed, Centric Relation
Left Profile (subject is facing observer's left) – Lips Closed, Centric Occlusion
Left Profile (subject is facing observer's left) - Lips Closed, Centric Relation
Left profile (subject is facing observer's left) - Full Smile, Centric Occlusion
Left Profile (subject is facing observer's left) - Full Smile, Centric Relation
Left Profile (subject is facing observer's left) - Mandible Postured Forward
45° Left Profile (subject turns toward observer's left) – Lips Relaxed, Centric Occlusion
45° Left Profile (subject turns toward observer's left) – Lips Relaxed, Centric Relation
45° Left Profile (subject turns toward observer's left) – Lips Closed, Centric Occlusion
45° Left Profile (subject turns toward observer's left) – Lips Closed, Centric Relation
45° Left Profile (subject turns toward observer's left) – Full Smile, Centric Occlusion
45° Left Profile (subject turns toward observer's left– Full Smile, Centric Relation
45° Left Profile (subject turns toward observer's left– Full Smile, Mandible Postured Forward
Other Face (head tipped back) – Inferior View (showing lower border of mandible, nares, infraorbital rim contours, forehead contours)
Other Face (viewed from above) – Superior View (showing forehead, infraorbital rim contour, dorsum of nose, upper lip, chin)
Example: Patient in mixed dentition may show the following teeth in this view
Other Face - Occlusal Cant (e.g., tongue depressor)
Other Face - Forensic Interest (tattoos, jewelry, scars)
Other Face - Anomalies (ears, skin tags, etc.)
